intro: Polygala insubrica, commonly known as the narrow-leaved milk-vetch, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale green or yellowish and are visited by various pollinators, including bees and flies. Polygala insubrica is a hardy species that is well adapted to drought conditions.
